messages.subject: Re: [nihontostudy] Mei quiz
messages.msgSnippet: I found a list of personal titles of swordsmiths on this page. http://www.sho-shin.com/ptitles.htm I guess these are the titles Tom are thinking of. To bad i
messages.messageBody:
I found a list of personal titles of swordsmiths on this page.
http://www.sho-shin.com/ptitles.htm
I guess these are the titles Tom are thinking of. To bad i cant find
Sinsanshi among them. The closest i see is a Ryusenshi for a fellow with
the name Hirotaka, but i guess this list is probably far from complete.

Fredrik

messages.subject: Re: [nihontostudy] Mei quiz
messages.msgSnippet: Tom You are right, with the exception of shi they are imposible for me to read. This is interesting, so I assumue that in generaly the names signed on blades
messages.messageBody:
Tom
You are right, with the exception of shi they are imposible for me to read.
This is interesting, so I assumue that in generaly the names signed on
blades arent the smiths given name by birth, but taken artistic names?
When it comes to Shinsenshi, I wonder if it is common for smiths to give
themself titles?
With the lack of official recognition like a kami or daijo maby its easy
make one up?
So you dont approve the idea that Shinsenshi beeing a clan name or
family name such as Taira or Fujiwara?

Sincerely
Fredrik


Tom Helm wrote:

>新泉子
>
>Fredrik-
> Not sure you'll be able to read the kanji, but Shinsenshi is more like
>an art "title." For example say the man's given name is Gorouemon his
>art name (working name ) is Hirotaka and he calls himself "new son of
>the purple sage Hirotaka." Shinsenshi is a name/title he has given
>himself perhaps in lieu of the official titles like Izumi no Kami that
>we often see...
>-t

messages.subject: Re: [nihontostudy] Mei quiz
messages.msgSnippet: $B?7@t;R(B Fredrik- Not sure you ll be able to read the kanji, but Shinsenshi is more like an art title. For example say the man s given name is Gorouemon
messages.messageBody:
新泉子

Fredrik-
Not sure you'll be able to read the kanji, but Shinsenshi is more like
an art "title." For example say the man's given name is Gorouemon his
art name (working name ) is Hirotaka and he calls himself "new son of
the purple sage Hirotaka." Shinsenshi is a name/title he has given
himself perhaps in lieu of the official titles like Izumi no Kami that
we often see...
-t

[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]

messages.subject: Re: [nihontostudy] Mei quiz
messages.msgSnippet: Hi Sukesada, yes ofcourse i see it now. I dont get much feeling in the blade, it belive its  not only the characters that are poor..:) Shinsenshi Hirotaka. I
messages.messageBody:
Hi

Sukesada, yes ofcourse i see it now. I dont get much feeling in the blade, it belive its not only the characters that are poor..:)

Shinsenshi Hirotaka. I belive you, tried to see it but i cant. Shinseshi would be a family name and Hirotaka the given name, right?

Btw, thanks alot for the help.

Fredrik

messages.subject: Mei quiz
messages.msgSnippet: Hello members, This is my first message to the list so greetings to all of you. I have a lot of questions specially regarding sending blades for togi. But in
messages.messageBody:
Hello members,

This is my first message to the list so greetings to all of you. I have
a lot of questions specially regarding sending blades for togi. But in
this message i wonder if anyone could help me with translating of mei i
have on two tantos. The first mei appears for me to be in Hiragana. Is
this common?
Sorry if the photos are bad im not a photografer..:)

First mei.
http://hem.bredband.net/odrike/Mei-1.jpg

Second mei
http://hem.bredband.net/odrike/Mei-2.jpg

If you would like to see the shapes of the blades.
http://hem.bredband.net/odrike/Nihonto-1.jpg
http://hem.bredband.net/odrike/Nihonto-2.jpg

Thanks for any sugestions or thoughts.

Fredrik

messages.subject: Tampa room-share
messages.msgSnippet: Hi all - A good friend of mine here in St. Louis--Ted Kiss, Nam vet, serious sword student--is looking for a place to sleep and shower at the Tampa show. I m
messages.messageBody:
Hi all -

A good friend of mine here in St. Louis--Ted Kiss, Nam vet, serious sword student--is looking for a place to sleep and shower at the Tampa show. I'm traveling with family, so I thought I'd ask to see if anyone is interested in sharing a room with Ted. Might only be on one night, possibly Friday and Saturday. His budget is tight, so I suggested this route. Let me know off-list at: swords@... or go direct to Ted at: wtkiss124@... (Some of you might remember Ted fro this past San Francisco show which he attended. Nice guy.)

Ron
STL

[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]
